channel.title: Medscape – Archives Health News
channel.description: Flux personnalisé des archives Medscape Health News

item.title: SGLT2 Inhibitors Reduce Portal Hypertension From Cirrhosis
item.description: Key outcomes of all-cause mortality and portal hypertension complications are improved with SGLT2inhibitors, new research shows. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: Infant Colic May Predict Later Risk for Atopic Disease
item.description: Having infant colic is associated with an increased risk for atopic conditions and respiratory illnesses throughout adolescence, new research shows. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: Can Sharing a Kiss Lead to Gluten Transfer?
item.description: Cross-contact with gluten is minimal for patients with celiac after sharing a kiss with someone who just ate food containing the wheat-based protein. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: Bone Marrow Lesions Linked to Ligament Lesions in Hand OA
item.description: Bone marrow lesions are less common but strongly associated with the more prevalent collateral ligament lesions in patients with hand osteoarthritis. (Medscape News UK, May 05 2025)

item.title: Do PARPi Increase Blood Cancer Risk in Ovarian Cancer?
item.description: A real-world analysis suggests a low incidence of secondary myelodysplastic syndrome and acute myeloid leukaemia in patients with advanced ovarian cancer on PARP inhibitor maintenance therapy. (Medscape News UK, May 05 2025)

item.title: HPV Vaccine Post-Surgery Cuts Viral Persistence
item.description: The administration of the HPV nonavalent vaccine after surgical treatment leads to a substantial reduction in HPV recurrence among women with HPV-related cervical lesions. (Medscape News UK, May 05 2025)

item.title: New Target for Fat-Burning Drugs Discovered in Mice Study
item.description: Animal studies have established the previously unknown role of a protein that helps activate brown fat, a tissue that can boost metabolism and improve glucose tolerance. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: Predicting Glycemic Responses Using Noninvasive Data
item.description: Predicting glycemic responses to food using limited data could allow for personalized nutrition planning for individuals with type 1 or type 2 diabetes without reliance on costly, invasive tests. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: Single Antiplatelet After TAVR Lowers Risk
item.description: New findings from real-world experience support the shift in practice to single antiplatelet therapy after transcatheter aortic valve replacement. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: What Do We Know About the Causes of Autism?
item.description: Scientists who have dedicated their careers to studying autism remain highly skeptical that a definitive answer to what causes autism can be reached within a few short months — if at all. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: FDA Okays DHE Nasal Spray for Acute Migraine
item.description: Atzumi combines a proprietary advanced powder and device technology to simplify nasal delivery of dihydroergotamine for acute treatment of migraine. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: New Safety Questions Over Mechanical Circulatory Support
item.description: Specialists are debating the best approach in cardiogenic shock after a new analysis of data comparing Impella with intra-aortic balloon pump has pointed to safety issues. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: Subtyping Thyroid Function Testing Halved Positive Diagnoses
item.description: The study challenged a ‘one-size-fits-all’ approach to defining thyroid function reference intervals. (Medscape Medical News, May 05 2025)

item.title: Do Mammograms Improve Breast Cancer Outcomes in Older Women?
item.description: Prior screening mammography is associated with earlier stage at breast cancer diagnosis and lower breast cancer mortality risk in women aged 70 years or older with screen-detected breast cancers. (Medscape Medical News, May 06 2025)

item.title: Are US Doctors Ready if Measles Becomes Endemic Again?
item.description: A new modeling study offers a stark look at caseloads in the next two decades if current trends hold. Can the nation’s healthcare system handle the strain? (Medscape Medical News, May 06 2025)

item.title: Early Osteoarthritis Needs Better Definition(s)
item.description: ‘The only way that we can really clarify which definition, or maybe definitions, are the most useful is for us to really systematically evaluate many of them,’ said Grace Hsiao-Wei Lo, MD, MS. (Medscape Medical News, May 06 2025)

item.title: New Henipavirus Detected in Alabama
item.description: Camp Hill virus surfaces in North America — efforts intensify to assess risks, track its spread, and define its potential health threat. (Medscape Medical News, May 06 2025)

item.title: ctDNA Positivity in CRC Links to Chemotherapy Response
item.description: Patients with CRC who test positive for ctDNA following curative resection show poorer disease-free survival but a greater response to chemotherapy than those who test negative. (Medscape Medical News, May 06 2025)

item.title: Obesity Care Roadblocks: Insurers vs Clinical Guidelines
item.description: Physicians describe common prior authorization challenges when treating patients for obesity and share strategies to overcome denials. (Medscape Medical News, May 06 2025)

item.title: Novel Shoes May Cut Low Back Pain, Delay Knee Arthroplasty
item.description: Two studies show that wearers of a foot-worn, home-based biomechanical intervention could reduce low back pain and risk for total knee replacement surgery in comparison with physical therapy. (Medscape Medical News, May 06 2025)
